instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: No Audio or Chime <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Have changed the I/O board, but not sure it?s 100% ok, bought a used one on ebay. No hardware detected, have reset nvram/pram, changed flex cable. But it detects my EZCAST which is on the same network connected to my tv, nor detection of headphones. Otherwise the air works flawless even usb on I/O board.

Any suggestions where to start

I saw the bios has been tampered with, It also was the wrong flex cable between the I/O board and MLB.

Thanks

threads.title: No Audio or Chime <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Did you try known good LIO flex too?
Check LIO connector on the MLB too.

threads.title: No Audio or Chime <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: When I bought the LIO from ebay it came with a new flex. Well, connector looks fine on both sides (under scoope). there is no signs of liquide anywhere. Not sure what to meassure.

threads.title: No Audio or Chime <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Check if voltage from pins 7 & 9 of J4700 arrive to LIO board.
Be sure <SIGNAL>HDA_RST_L</SIGNAL> stays  high.
Also check resistance to ground (diode mode) on all HDA_ lines...

threads.title: No Audio or Chime <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: Hi Sri if it going slow, stuck with flue.....will take a ffew days to get back with results.
